hallmark.translation[0].definitions[0].d: an idea, method, or quality that is typical of a particular person or thing
hallmark.translation[0].definitions[0].e: The explosion had all the hallmarks of a terrorist attack.
Their performance did not bear the hallmark of European champions.
These hotels still offer the sort of service which was the hallmark of the grand days of travel.
hallmark.translation[0].definitions[1].d: a mark put on silver, gold, or platinum that shows the quality of the metal, and where and when it was made
hallmark.translation[1].definitions[0].d: to put a hallmark on silver, gold, or platinum
hallmark.translation[2].definitions[0].d: a US company that makes greetings cards
hallmark.translation[3].definitions[0].d: an idea, quality, or skill that is typical of a particular person or thing
hallmark.translation[3].definitions[0].e: Their ability to work under tight deadlines is a hallmark of their professionalism.
hallmark.translation[3].definitions[1].d: a mark put on an object made of silver, gold, or PLATINUM that shows the quality of the metal, and where and when it was made
hallmark.translation[4].definitions[0].d: to put a hallmark on silver, gold, or PLATINUM
